      • PerfWritingHttpServletResponse

        public PerfWritingHttpServletResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                              javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response,
                              Enum<?> stat,
                              String perfStatsHeader,
                              PerfStats.OutputFormat format)
        Initialize with all parameters.
        Parameters:
        request - requestURI is used as cookie path
        response - wrapped response
        stat - names stat for total elapsed time.
        perfStatsHeader - names HTTP header field for dumping all stats.
        format - format of perfStatsHeader

    • Method Detail

      • writePerfStats

        public void writePerfStats()
        Write performance metrics to HTTP header field and Cookie. You don't need to call this method explicitly. It is called implicitly by calls to sendError(int), sendRedirect(String), getWriter() or getOutputStream(). 2014-11-17 Now it doesn't call timeEnd for perfStat. Be sure to call endNow() explicitly.

      • enablePerfCookie

        public void enablePerfCookie()
        Deprecated. 1.8.1, no replacement. this method has no effect.

      • setPerfCookie

        public void setPerfCookie(boolean perfCookie)
        Set to true if wb_total_perf cookie should be set in the response. In general this is a bad idea because it'll defeat front-end caching. As such, this is off by default.
        Parameters:
        perfCookie - true for sending out the cookie
